lead_paragraph: Scientists in Shanghai are trying to locate the deficiency in the ‘brain circuits’ responsible for autism-like behavior found in genetically engineered monkeys.

headline.print_headline: Monkeys Are Genetically Engineered to Test Autism Therapies
headline.main: Monkeys Built to Mimic Autism-Like Behaviors May Help Humans

snippet: Scientists in Shanghai are trying to locate the deficiency in the ‘brain circuits’ responsible for autism-like behavior found in genetically engineered monkeys.
abstract: Chinese scientists, in study published in journal Nature, report having genetically engineered monkeys to manifest behaviors similar to that of autism, in effort to better understand disorder; experts point out limitations of research involving injection of human gene linked to autism into monkeys; previous experiments on mice were limited by simplicity of mouse's brains and short lifespan.
